channel.title: 508 variables help

item.title: 508 variables help
item.dc:creator: @00rYn00 00rYn00
item.description:
@00rYn00 wrote:

Okay so I’m working on summoning, making a crappy version of it since the other versions that I tried to add (that were the runescape way) ended up not working, so until I can get those working I’m using this method.
Okay so I’m in ItemOperate.java and I want it to where if the user has a certain spirit pouch (spirit wolf) then it spawns the npc for the spirit wolf… Okay so I already know how to make the npc spawn that’s not what I’m having trouble with, the problem is that the variables changed and I can’t seem to find what the variable for (this is 474 variable) hasItem…
so I tryed p.hasItem(12047, 1)) {
and it says there is no “hasItem” variable… so is my code wrong or do I need to add the variable hasItem?
btw the full code for what I’m trying to do is

case 10367:  //Spirit Wolf Summoning 
        if (p.hasItem(12047, 1)) {
        Engine.newNPC(6829, p.absX, p.absY, p.heightLevel, p.absX + 1, p.absY + 1, p.absX + -1, p.absY + -1, false);
        p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You summon a Spirit Wolf"); 
        } else {
        p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You don't have a Summoning Pouch");
        }       
        break;

Thanks to anyone that helps me out

Read full topic
